subject: Critical issue: Critical infrastructure issue in cdn (us-east-1)

messages.content:
Subject: Critical issue: Critical infrastructure issue in cdn (us-east-1)

Automated detection from monitoring system:

A critical issue has been detected in the CDN service in the us-east-1 region, characterized by high resource utilization. Current metrics indicate CPU usage at 90.95%, memory usage at 96.52%, disk I/O at 349.4 Mbps, and network I/O at 965.39 Mbps. This issue is likely due to increased traffic or insufficient resource allocation, affecting all users relying on this service. Users may experience degraded performance, including slow content delivery and increased latency. This issue is recurring and requires customer notification.

Service: cdn
Region: us-east-1
Severity: critical
Event Type: infrastructure

Metrics:
{
  "cpu_percent": 90.95,
  "memory_percent": 96.52,
  "disk_io_mbps": 349.4,
  "network_io_mbps": 965.39
}

Workaround: Scale up resources or optimize current resource usage to handle the load. Investigate traffic patterns for anomalies.

This ticket was auto-generated by the AI monitoring system.

extracted_fields.impact: Degraded performance including slow content delivery and increased latency for all users relying on the service.

merged_extracted_fields.impact: Degraded performance including slow content delivery and increased latency for all users relying on the service.

current_triage.rationale: The ticket describes a critical infrastructure issue affecting all users in the CDN service, indicating a severe impact on service performance.

current_routing.reasoning: Routed to engineering due to outage classification. SLA set based on enterprise tier and P0 priority. Escalated due to P0 critical priority.
